title: Our Place Always Pan 2.0 Review: Does This Blue Salt Beauty Live Up to the Hype?
metaDescription: Honest review of the Our Place Always Pan 2.0. Is this toxin-free ceramic nonstick pan really worth it? Here's what I found after months of use.
content:
## My First Impression

The first thing you notice is how substantial it feels. This isn't some flimsy nonstick pan that'll warp after a few uses. The aluminum construction feels solid, and that ceramic coating has a really nice texture to it. Plus, that Blue Salt color? It's gorgeous. Way prettier than the standard black pans cluttering most kitchens.

## What Makes This Pan Different

The whole 10-in-1 thing isn't just marketing fluff - you really can use this for a ton of different cooking methods. I've sautéed vegetables, made pancakes, cooked rice, steamed dumplings, and even baked a frittata in the oven. The versatility is genuinely impressive.

What really sold me was the toxin-free ceramic nonstick surface. I'm trying to move away from traditional nonstick coatings, and this ceramic alternative performs surprisingly well. Food slides right off, and cleanup is usually just a gentle wipe with a sponge.

The heat distribution is pretty even too. I don't get those annoying hot spots that burn part of my eggs while leaving other parts undercooked. And it works on all cooktops - I have induction at home and gas at my parents' place, and it performs great on both.

## Real-World Performance

Let me tell you about actually cooking with this thing. Making scrambled eggs? Buttery smooth. The ceramic surface is so slick that I barely need any oil. Searing chicken thighs gives you that nice golden crust without sticking. And when I make my weekend pancakes, they flip like a dream.

The oven-safe feature up to 450°F is clutch. I start dishes on the stovetop and finish them in the oven all the time. No need to dirty another pan or transfer food around.

One thing I really appreciate is how well it cleans up. Even when I've made something messy like caramelized onions or cheese quesadillas, everything wipes off easily. No scrubbing required.

## The Not-So-Perfect Parts

Look, it's not perfect. The ceramic coating, while great initially, does show some wear after heavy use. It's still nonstick, but not quite as effortlessly slick as when it was brand new. This seems pretty normal for ceramic coatings though.

The handle gets warm during longer cooking sessions. Not dangerously hot, but warm enough that I sometimes grab a towel. And speaking of the handle, while it looks sleek, it's not the most comfortable grip for extended use.

Also, despite being dishwasher safe, I hand wash mine because I want to preserve that ceramic coating as long as possible. Not a huge deal, but worth mentioning if you're someone who relies heavily on the dishwasher.

## Who Should Consider This Pan

If you're looking to replace multiple pans with one versatile option, this makes sense. It's particularly great for small kitchens where storage is tight, or for anyone trying to move away from traditional nonstick coatings.

The design factor is real too - if you care about how your cookware looks (and let's be honest, we all Instagram our food sometimes), this pan is definitely photogenic.

It's also solid for anyone who does a lot of one-pan meals or likes to experiment with different cooking techniques. The versatility really shines when you're willing to explore what it can do.

## Bottom Line

This isn't just another pretty pan with good marketing. The Always Pan 2.0 actually delivers on most of its promises. Sure, it has some quirks and the ceramic coating won't stay perfect forever, but for everyday cooking, it's been a reliable workhorse in my kitchen.

Is it revolutionary? No. But it's a well-made, versatile pan that looks great and performs consistently. Sometimes that's exactly what you need.
pros: Truly versatile - handles multiple cooking methods well
Ceramic nonstick coating performs excellently when new
Even heat distribution prevents hot spots
Works on all cooktop types including induction
Oven safe up to 450°F for finishing dishes
Easy cleanup with just soap and water
Beautiful Blue Salt color adds style to the kitchen
cons: Ceramic coating shows wear after heavy use
Handle gets warm during longer cooking sessions
Not the most comfortable grip for extended use
Requires hand washing to preserve coating longevity
verdict: The Always Pan 2.0 delivers solid performance and genuine versatility in a beautiful package. While the ceramic coating won't stay perfect forever, it's a reliable choice for everyday cooking that actually lives up to most of its claims.
targetAudience: Home cooks seeking versatile, toxin-free cookware, small kitchen owners looking to consolidate pans, and anyone wanting stylish cookware that performs well across multiple cooking methods
